meanings.definition: To detain (someone) in conversation against their will.
meanings.sent1: She kept buttonholing me with her long stories.
meanings.sent2: He buttonholed his friend to talk about the latest movie.
meanings.sent3: During the party, he was buttonholing everyone with his jokes.
meanings.sent4: The salesman buttonholed the customer with his persuasive pitch.
meanings.sent5: The teacher buttonholed the student to discuss their grades.

meanings.definition: To sew a buttonhole in (a garment).
meanings.sent1: She was buttonholing the coat to make it look neat.
meanings.sent2: The tailor buttonholed the shirt for a perfect fit.
meanings.sent3: He buttonholed the dress quickly before the event.
meanings.sent4: The seamstress buttonholed the jacket with precision.
meanings.sent5: Buttonholing the pants required careful stitching.

meanings.definition: The act of engaging someone in conversation against their will.
meanings.sent1: His constant buttonholing made people avoid him.
meanings.sent2: The politician's buttonholing tactics were well-known.
meanings.sent3: The buttonholing at the meeting was getting out of hand.
meanings.sent4: She found herself in a buttonholing situation with a stranger.
meanings.sent5: The buttonholing by the chatty neighbor was exhausting.
